name: B. Little Elephant and Magic Square
statement:
Little Elephant loves magic squares very much.A is a table, each cell
contains some positive integer. At that the sums of integers in all
rows, columns and diagonals of the table are equal. The figure below
shows the magic square, the sum of integers in all its rows, columns and
diagonals equals 15. The Little Elephant remembered one magic square. He
started writing this square on a piece of paper, but as he wrote, he
forgot all three elements of the main diagonal of the magic square.
Fortunately, the Little Elephant clearly remembered that all elements of
the magic square did not exceed . Help the Little Elephant, restore the
original magic square, given the Elephant’s notes.
editorial:
Since each number is less than or equal to , you can loop all possible
values, the rest of cells can be calculated from this.
